description: The scene depicts an unusual setup above a fireplace, where a large mirror is suspended, attracting several oversized insects.  These insects, resembling flies or mosquitos with prominent proboscises, are drawn towards the reflective surface instead of the fire below. This arrangement creates a surreal environment where the mirror acts as a bizarre, fatal lure, subverting the natural instinct of creatures drawn to light or heat. The sequence of insects approaching the mirror adds to the disturbing, almost ritualistic implication of their attraction to this unnatural object. The presence of a large, butterfly-like insect among them highlights a varied, yet equally doomed, response to the artificial 'flame'.
